page.title: 07Arrow Valley Park.
page.content: In 1973 the{Redditch Development {Corporation}decided a park should be provided for the people of Redditch. The park spans the banks of the{River {Arrow}from the{Needle Museum}in the north to the{Washford Mill Inn}in the south. A{man-made lake}of 30 acres was dug and the soil used for the building of{highway}embankments. The lake is used for dinghy sailing, sailboarding, canoeing and{fishing.}The lake is stocked with Rudd, Perch, Roach and Carp. It is appropriate that there should be good fishing in a town with a history of fishing tackle making. The park has picnic areas, pathways and a bridleway. There are various open spaces (some left wild), football pitches and newly planted areas in the park's 900 acres. It is the site of the annual{Water Fiesta}and{Chicken {Run. }
